result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan Michael Brecke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs due during term of probation. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
No contact with HB or any females under the age of 18. Except incidental at work, in a supervised setting, or Defendant's sister. Comply with sex offender registry. Submit to DNA analysis.

superMiscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Dept of Corrections to collect from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account, an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
No contact with HB or any females under the age of 18. Except incidental at work, in a supervised setting, or Defendant's sister. Comply with sex offender registry. Submit to DNA analysis.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Evan Michael Brecke

10:14 AM Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Evan Michael Brecke appeared by video from the Ozaukee County jail, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Evan Michael Brecke. Counsel previously efiled plea questionniare.  Court examines Defendant, accpets change of plea to guilty, and finds Defendant guilty. State will recommend at sentencing: Count 1 - S/W 10 years probation cs Count 2 w/conditions: NCW with HB or any females under the age of 18 except incidental at work or in a supervised setting, comply with sex offender registry; Count 2 - 6 yrs WSP 3 yrs IC 3 yrs ES. Defendant to be in person for sentencing hearing. Court revokes bail and remands defendant until sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on August 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
filed by Atty Dvoran

1:53 PM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Evan Michael Brecke appeared by video, in custody from the Ozaukee County Jail, Attorney Heather Dvoran appeared in court for Evan Michael Brecke. Counsel previously efiled waiver of preliminary hearing. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver of preliminary hearing and binds matter over for trial. State files information. Counsel enters not guilty plea. Counsel requests underlying revocation case to track. No objection by DA. Court orders revocation case to track.

Court reviews case history. Court examines Defendant on status of counsel. Court adjourns matter for Defendant to contact PD Office. Court finds good cause to extend time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status hearing on February 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
No contact with: HB or their family. No contact with any females under the age of 18 except for incidental at work or other supervised setting.

01:05 PM Defendant Evan Michael Brecke via video conference from the Ozaukee County Jail with attorney Heather Dvoran as a friend of the court. Defendant in custody Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant will retain private counsel.  Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $10,000 cash bail w/conditions. Counsel requests $2,000 cash bail and advises Defendant is on PO hold. Court finds good cause to extend time limits and sets matter for status.  Status hearing scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
